author: robocopsgonemad
content: yes, but this test is sending a non zero, non null parentBeaconRoot, with a cancun timestamp, to fcuv2. so this is well formed, just mis-targeting the wrong rpc call.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: and the test is failing because it is expecting INVALID_PARAMS, but we are returning UNSUPPORTED_FORK_ERROR.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: it also seems the explanation above is now contradicted by `ForkchoiceUpdatedV2 To Request Cancun Payload, Nil Beacon Root (Cancun)`

author: robocopsgonemad
content: which says if you try to build a cancun payload via fcuv2, and omit the the beaconroot, it should return UNSUPPORTED_FORK_ERROR

author: rjected
content: ~~this one was sort of weird for us to implement too, because normally unknown fields (w.r.t. the fcuv2 method arguments, which don't have a beaconroot field) are ignored. we had to make deserialization more strict to get this test working properly~~ or wait, sorry we had to do that for a different test

author: marioevz
content:
This is trying to apply rule 1 to fcuv2: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/cancun.md#specification-1

That is, if there are extra fields, return invalid params as the first check.

author: marioevz
content: Whereas this one passes the "fields strictly matches the expected one" check and then fails the rule 2
